intro: Dieteria canescens var. canescens, commonly known as the slender dieteria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance. The species is also valued for its role in supporting local pollinators and ecological biodiversity.
